title: George W. Bush Presidential Library: NSC Correspondence Related to Lia, Georgia Radiological Accident

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All information, analyses, summaries, assessments, transcripts, audio or visual recordings, or similar records included in National Security Correspondence related to the Lia radiological accident and the accident's aftermath. The Lia radiological incident occurred in the country of Georgia in late 2001 and early 2002. The accident was the result of improperly stored and abandoned Soviet-era radioisotope thermoelectric generators. This accident resulted in the injuries to three Georgian villagers. The accident happened just months after 9/11 and the government of Georgia openly asked for international assistance from the International Atomic Energy Agency (the IAEA) in locating the material. 

This incident is likely to have generated considerable national security correspondence. Georgia's government was an ally of the United States. The United States is a member of the IAEA, and the Georgian government requesed help from the IAEA. Issues related to errant nuclear materials in the former Soviet Union were a prerogative of the United States as part of the Cooperative Threat Reduction program created by the Nunn-Lugar act. In the aftermath of the 9/11 attacks, threats related to "dirty bomb" attacks were routinely reported on in nightly newscasts and in the newspapers. 

More information about the Lia incident can be found in this report published by the IAEA:

https://www-pub.iaea.org/MTCD/Publications/PDF/Pub1660web-81061875.pdf

Please conduct a search for information, analyses, summaries, assessments, transcripts, audio or visual recordings, or similar records related to the Lia, Georgia incident. Limit the search to documents related to the Lia incident created from December 2nd 2001 to December 2nd 2005. An additional interest would be if the Lia incident and the aftermath was discussed in relation to the beginning of the Saakashvili administration some years later. 

Thank you for your commitment to transparency and I look forward to working together until this request is resolved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: U. of Maryland Terrorism and Targeted Violence (T2V) project data

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The underlying data that populated the "Data Portal" of the National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism's "Terrorism and Targeted Violence (T2V)" project. The program was terminated March 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

George LeVines

title: Contract awarded to Rutgers Southern Regional CCR&R  for the administration of the New Jersey Child Care Assistance Program (CCAP)

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Contract awarded to Rutgers Southern Regional CCR&R  for the administration of the New Jersey Child Care Assistance Program (CCAP)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Contract awarded to Rutgers Southern Regional CCR&R  for the administration of the New Jersey Child Care Assistance Program (CCAP) by the NJ Department of Human Services, Division of Family Development.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Toni Thompson

title: Police Report Request on Compliance Search

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Police Report Request on Compliance Search
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

police reports with all pages of investigation summaries and information. Arrest warrant reports, evidence log for AGENCY CASE: 84-25-01576 and warrant documents with probable cause summary no: RIV_2025_001098

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Esther Reddington

title: Customs Declarations and Shipping Records for Pecans Shipment (LLC Pecans Plus → Rubbers-Polymers, Inc.)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Customs Declarations and Shipping Records for Pecans Shipment (LLC Pecans Plus → Rubbers-Polymers, Inc.)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

related to an international shipment involving LLC Pecans Plus and Rubbers-Polymers, Inc. that entered the United States through the Port of Savannah, Georgia, on or around October 5, 2021:

Requested Records:
CBP Form 7501 (Entry Summary)

Bill of Lading and any associated shipping documents

Commercial invoices, packing lists, product descriptions

Declared product values and Harmonized Tariff Schedule (HTS) codes

Importer Security Filing (ISF), if applicable

Any other customs declarations or documents related to this shipment

Shipment Details:
Exporter: LLC Pecans Plus

Address: 21 Degtyarivska Street, Office 107/3, Kyiv, Ukraine

Importer: Rubbers-Polymers, Inc.

Address: 200 Wesleyan Avenue, Albany, GA 31721, USA

Product: Shelled and Unshelled Pecans

Total Weight: Approximately 26,805 kilograms (≈ 60,000 lbs)

Arrival Date: On or about October 5, 2021

Port of Entry: Savannah, GA

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David J. Gregors, Esquire

title: Betar US deportation list and correspondence

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Betar US deportation list and correspondence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The organization Betar US says that it has sent Attorney General Bondi a list of names of people it would like the Trump Administration to deport from the United States. Please produce that list. Please also produce all other correspondence between the Department of Justice (including any of its components, officers, employees, or agents) and Betar US (including any of its officers, employees, or agents). This includes all emails sent to or from a “betarus.org” email address.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Francis Lee Maidir
